formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Permutations (nPr) If order matters and repetition is not allowed, the number of permutations of \( r \) objects out of \( n \) distinct objects is: \[ {}_nP_r = P(n, r) = \frac{n!}{(n-r)!} \] Combinations (nCr) If order does not matter and repetition is not allowed, the number of combinations of \( r \) objects out of \( n \) is: \[ {}_nC_r = C(n, r) = \binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{r!(n-r)!} \]

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Permutations with repetition If you can reuse each symbol and there are \( n \) possible symbols for each of the \( r \) positions, the number of permutations is: \[ P_{\text{rep}}(n, r) = n^r \] Combinations with repetition Selections with repetition allowed (multisets) are counted by the classical "stars and bars" formula: \[ C_{\text{rep}}(n, r) = \binom{n + r - 1}{r} = \frac{(n + r - 1)!}{r!(n - 1)!} \]
